pr_title: chore(exporter): Return a cancellable ScheduledTask when creating a scheduled task.

timeline.author: deepthidevaki

timeline.bodyText: Do we need a new method for this? Or just change the return type of scheduleTask?
timeline.author: deepthidevaki

replies.bodyText: I'm thinking about backward compatibility in this case because I'm thinking that this is a part of public API or I'm wrong? :)
replies.author: aivinog1

replies.bodyText: That's right. It is a public API. Changing return type from void to a non-void object will not break source compatibility - but it will beak binary compatibility. @npepinpe I guess then it will be an issue for external exporters? So we have to keep two different methods with void and non-void return types.
replies.author: deepthidevaki

replies.bodyText: Keep in mind that we don't expect many exporter authors to be implementing their own controller. At most, they might be mocking it. I would still mark the void method as deprecated however so already they start using the new method.
replies.author: npepinpe

replies.bodyText: @deepthidevaki Done, I've added a deprecation JavaDoc and annotation
replies.author: aivinog1

timeline.bodyText: Please add some docs here since this is a public api.
timeline.author: deepthidevaki

timeline.bodyText: To test this, you don't have to export anything. So you can directly schedule a task on the exporter. No need to schedule it using exporter.onExport.
timeline.author: deepthidevaki

replies.bodyText:
@deepthidevaki Well, I'm trying to do this:
Index: broker/src/test/java/io/zeebe/broker/exporter/stream/ExporterDirectorTest.java
IDEA additional info:
Subsystem: com.intellij.openapi.diff.impl.patch.CharsetEP
<+>UTF-8
===================================================================
--- broker/src/test/java/io/zeebe/broker/exporter/stream/ExporterDirectorTest.java	(revision 130d0893c8d50b421d7b48e68fcd5cdba095c6af)
+++ broker/src/test/java/io/zeebe/broker/exporter/stream/ExporterDirectorTest.java	(date 1606299556914)
@@ -393,16 +393,15 @@
     final CountDownLatch timerTriggerLatch = new CountDownLatch(1);
     final CountDownLatch timerScheduledLatch = new CountDownLatch(1);
     final Duration delay = Duration.ofSeconds(10);
-
+    startExporterDirector(exporterDescriptors);
     final ControlledTestExporter exporter = exporters.get(0);
-    exporter.onExport(
-        r -> {
-          exporter.getController().scheduleCancellableTask(delay, timerTriggerLatch::countDown);
-          timerScheduledLatch.countDown();
-        });
+    verify(exporter, TIMEOUT).open(any());
 
     // when
-    startExporterDirector(exporterDescriptors);
+    exporter
+        .getController()
+        .scheduleCancellableTask(delay, timerTriggerLatch::countDown);
+    timerScheduledLatch.countDown();
 
     writeEvent();
 
But I get this error:

Do I do something wrong? 🤔
replies.author: aivinog1

replies.bodyText: Oops. My mistake. I think you have to then call it with in exporter.onExport() or exporter.onOpen()
replies.author: deepthidevaki
